00030 // Possible exceptions recognized by the machine
00031 enum ExceptionType { NoException,           
00032                      SyscallException,      
00033                      ReadOnlyException,     
00035                      BusErrorException,     
00039                      AddressErrorException, 
00042                      OverflowException,     
00043                      IllegalInstrException, 
00044                      
00045                      NumExceptionTypes
00046 };

00048 // User program CPU state.  The full set of MIPS registers, plus a few
00049 // more because we need to be able to start/stop a user program between
00050 // any two instructions (thus we need to keep track of things like load
00051 // delay slots, etc.)
00052 
00053 #define StackReg        29      
00054 #define RetAddrReg      31      
00055 #define NumGPRegs       32      
00056 #define HiReg           32      
00057 #define LoReg           33
00058 #define PCReg           34      
00059 #define NextPCReg       35      
00060 #define PrevPCReg       36      
00061 #define LoadReg         37      
00062 #define LoadValueReg    38      
00063 #define BadVAddrReg     39      
00064 
00065 #define NumIntRegs      40      
00066 #define NumFPRegs       32      
00067 
00068

00079     void Decode();      
00080 
00081     unsigned int value; 
00082 
00083     int opCode;     
00086     char rs, rt, rd; 
00087     char fs, ft, fd; 
00088     int extra;       
00091 };

00147 // Data structures -- all of these are accessible to Nachos kernel code.
00148 // "public" for convenience.
00149 //
00150 // Note that *all* communication between the user program and the kernel 
00151 // are in terms of these data structures.
00152 
00153     int int_registers[NumIntRegs]; 
00154 
00155     int float_registers[NumFPRegs]; 
00156 
00157     char cc;                     
00162     char *mainMemory;           
00166   private:
00167     bool singleStep;            
00170    Time runUntilTime;           
00173 };

00176 // Defined in exception.cc
00177 extern void ExceptionHandler(ExceptionType which, int vaddr);
00178 
00179 
00180 // Routines for converting Words and Short Words to and from the
00181 // simulated machine's format of little endian.  If the host machine
00182 // is little endian (DEC and Intel), these end up being NOPs.
00183 //
00184 // What is stored in each format:
00185 //      - host byte ordering:
00186 //         - kernel data structures
00187 //         - user registers
00188 //      - simulated machine byte ordering:
00189 //         - contents of main memory
00190 unsigned int WordToHost(unsigned int word);
00191 unsigned short ShortToHost(unsigned short shortword);
00192 unsigned int WordToMachine(unsigned int word);
00193 unsigned short ShortToMachine(unsigned short shortword);
00194 
00195 #endif // MACHINE_H
